title: 10 dangerous fashion trends

multiple-choice.question: What was the name of the Swedish chemist who developed copper arsenate, an intense, yellow-green pigment in 1775?

What was the name of the toxin that was used in the coating that went on wool to protect the fabric, which caused serious chemical burns to over 60 men in 1898?
What was the name of the disease that hatters suffered from due to mercury poisoning?
What was the name of the compound that was used to whiten faces in 16th and 17th-century England, which caused scarring, headaches, nausea, muscle damage, baldness, and eventually early death?

What was the name of the group of factory workers in the United States who painted watch faces with glowing paint and were bathed in radioactive dust every day, suffering from anemia, “radium jaw” and bone cancers?
What was the name of the compound derived from a poisonous plant called Deadly Nightshade, which was used to dilate pupils for a striking doe-eyed look?
What was the name of the synthetic plastic that was manufactured using a compound called cellulose nitrate, which was highly flammable?
What was the name of the disease that people who were exposed to large amounts of asbestos tend to develop, which is an otherwise-rare lung cancer?
What was the name of the compound that was used to make felt hats, which caused mercury poisoning and Mad Hatter Disease?

options.label: B

options.label: D

options.label: D
